results.title: The Fiddlers of James Bay
results.creator_credit: Bob Rodgers, Mark Zannis and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Scots from the Orkney Islands came to trade in Northern Quebec during the 17th century. They brought fiddles with them and introduced a new form of music to the Cree of James Bay. The music survived long after the Scots returned home. In this film two Cree fiddlers travel to the Orkney Islands, the birthplace of the music they learned from their fathers and grandfathers. The film captures the warmth and good will of this reunion.

results.title: The Feeling of rejection: its development and growth
results.creator_credit: Robert Anderson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The case history of Margaret, a 23-year-old girl who has physical disorders with no physical causes. A psychiatrist shows her the root of her troubles—childhood overprotection and discouragement of her efforts to express herself, resulting in a crippling fear of failure and a complete inability to assert herself. When Margaret understands her problem, she develops new and healthier habits of behavior. (Awards: Chicago; Rome; Manila.) Produced for the Dept. of National Health and Welfare.

results.title: The FBI
results.creator_credit: George McCowan, Charles Larson, Quinn Martin, Seven Arts and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: This television series screened between 1965 and 1975. Its production was endorsed by the Federal Bureau of Investigation with episodes based on actual FBI case files. Its emotionless portrayal of agents tracking down criminals provides a cool and compelling atmosphere. This episode called “Southwind” sees a banker escaping on a plane with two million dollars. Not only has he stolen money he has left gambling debts and a man injured in hospital. With no leads it is left to the methodical actions of the FBI agents to find the missing banker. This is a series where politics and drama meet as each episode was allegedly approved by J. Edgar Hoover himself. Cast includes Efrem Zimblist Jr., Philip Abbot and William Reynolds.

results.title: The Fatal game
results.creator_credit: Richard Dennison, James Heyward, J A A Films and Orana Films
results.brief_description: Australian Mike Rheinberger has made six attempts to reach the top of Mount Everest. His dream of conquering the mountain has become an obsession. On his seventh attempt, he and companion Mark Whetu finally reach the top and soon plunge into nightmare. After the elation of victory comes the realisation that it is too late to walk down to camp before nightfall. At 29,000 feet, they bivouac on a ridge, enduring temperatures of minus 25 degrees Celsius. The pair survives the night in what in called “the death zone” only to be awakened to a situation of extreme urgency. Mark Whetu is left to make a decision that will stay with him forever …

results.title: The Family that dwelt apart
results.creator_credit: Yvon Mallette, Robert Verrall, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Cartoon animation of a story by E.B. White, first published in the New Yorker magazine in 1937. This is a tall Yankee tale about a family of seven fisherfolk who are living quite happily as the sole inhabitants of a small island in Barnetuck Bay until word somehow gets to the mainland that they are in distress. What happens when rescue attempts are launched makes an amusing story, illustrated with wit and verve by the film animation. Narrated by E.B. White. Also available on DVD [319319].

results.title: The Fat film
results.creator_credit: Frank J. Lisciandro, John Lengsfelder, Katherine Lisciandro, Image Associates and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: Americans have the most fat-filled diet in the world. On an average, over 40% of the calories eaten daily by Americans are fats. A diet high in fat dramatically increases the risk of coronary heart disease, stroke, atherosclerosis, diabetes and cancer. This program outlines constructive nutritional advice for reducing fat content in our diets and thereby improving our health and decreasing our cholesterol level.

results.title: The Famine within
results.brief_description: The Famine within is a Canadian feature length documentary film about the contemporary obsession with body size and shape. Under the coercive powers of consumerism and the mass media, women have come to view their bodies as marketable objects and to judge them according to the unrealistic standards of the body ideal. Combining the direct testimony of many women who have suffered from body obsession, this film explores the kind of hunger that cannot be satisfied by food. Best Feature Documentary 1991 Genie Awards (Canada).

results.title: The Extraordinary adventures of the mouse and his child
results.creator_credit: Charles Swenson, Fred Wolf, Walt de Faria, deFaria-Lockhart Productions and Sanrio America
results.brief_description: This animated story of the thrilling adventures of a toy mouse and his child is based on the modern classic of children’s fiction written by Russell Hoban. From their home in the toy shop window, the mouse and his child find themselves cast into a rubbish tip where they become prisoners of the slimy rat, Manny (voice of Peter Ustinov). Helped by their friends, a fortune-telling rat, an actress parrot, a performing seal and a pink elephant, the mouse and his child plot to escape Manny’s evil clutches and discover how they can become self-winding.

results.title: The Fairy faith
results.creator_credit: John Walker, Kent Martin, John Walker Productions and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Fairies, fair folk, elves, trolls, pixies, brownies, goblins… Before being relegated to the realm of childhood fantasy by the scientific thinking of Victorian times, fairies existed as part of a rich and ancient belief system practised in many cultures. Filmmaker John Walker investigates the continued appeal of fairy lore in a world obsessed with materialism and rational thinking in this beautifully filmed documentary filled with the stunning landscapes that have fuelled tales of fairy folk for generations. He travels to the moors of England, the Highlands of Scotland, and sacred sites within Ireland and Cape Breton, discussing the origins of fairy lore, sightings of “the little people” and modern attitudes to the fairy faith. Walker interviews artist Brian Froud and reveals the inspiration for his fairy artworks, discusses the reality and physical possibility of fairies with scholar in seeing the paranormal Dr. Mark Fox, and meets Eddie Lenihan, a storyteller who saves an old fairy thorn tree from being destroyed by town developers.

results.title: The Experiment = Das Experiment
results.creator_credit: Oliver Hirschbiegel, Fritz Wildfeuer, Marc Conrad, Norbert Preuss, Fanes Film, Senator Film Production and Typhoon Pictures
results.brief_description: In his directorial debut Oliver Hirschbiegel brings together a taut drama based on a novel by Mario Giordano (“Black Box”) about a human behaviour experiment. Offered 4000 marks, 20 men are recruited for a two-week experiment where they will role-play either prison inmates or guards. A journalist Tarek (Moritz Bleibtreu, of “Run Lola Run” fame) working mainly as a taxi driver takes part wearing high tech video-recording glasses. Once roles are assigned, uniforms are put on - militaristic ones for the guards and a simple numbered smock for the prisoners - and the rules for the experiment are made clear. Like a ‘Lord of The Flies’ but for adults locked in a cage with similarly shocking results - after only three days things go awry and the corruptible nature of power in the human psyche asserts itself. Dark and industrial setting with hard-rock sound track (‘Linkin Park’ are featured) add to the oppressive and harsh environment in which the story takes place. Cast includes Maren Eggert, Christian Bekel, Justus Von Dohnany and Oliver Stokowski. Bleibtreu won Best Actor for this role at two film festivals.
